Skull.definition: The skull protects the brain and supports the structures of the face.
Skull.function: Protects the brain and sensory organs; provides attachment for jaw and facial muscles.

Femur.definition: The femur is the longest and strongest bone in the human body.
Femur.function: Supports body weight during standing, walking and running; articulates with hip and knee.

Humerus.definition: Long bone of the upper arm between shoulder and elbow.
Humerus.function: Supports arm movement and muscle attachment for lifting and manipulation.

Ribcage.definition: Curved bones that form the rib cage, protecting thoracic organs.
Ribcage.function: Protects heart and lungs; supports breathing by expanding and contracting the chest cavity.

Vertebrae.definition: Series of small bones forming the backbone.
Vertebrae.function: Protects spinal cord; provides structural support and flexibility to the torso.

Sternum.definition: Flat bone located in the center of the chest.
Sternum.function: Connects to ribs via cartilage; protects heart and lungs.

Hipbone.definition: Large bone structure at the base of the spine.
Hipbone.function: Supports weight of upper body; provides attachment for leg muscles; protects pelvic organs.

Metacarpals.definition: Bones of the hand located between the wrist and fingers.
Metacarpals.function: Provide structure to the hand; facilitate movement and dexterity.

Phalanges.definition: Bones that make up the fingers and toes.
Phalanges.function: Enable fine motor skills in fingers; provide balance and support in toes.

Tibia.definition: The larger and stronger of the two bones in the lower leg.
Tibia.function: Supports body weight; provides attachment for muscles of the lower leg.

Radius.definition: One of the two long bones in the forearm, located on the thumb side.
Radius.function: Enables rotation of the forearm; supports wrist movement.

Scapula.definition: Flat triangular bone located in the upper back.
Scapula.function: Connects humerus with clavicle; provides attachment for shoulder muscles.

Clavicle.definition: Long bone that serves as a strut between the shoulder blade and the sternum.
Clavicle.function: Provides support for shoulder; allows for a wide range of arm movements.

Patella.definition: Small bone located in front of the knee joint.
Patella.function: Protects knee joint; improves leverage of thigh muscles during leg extension.

Carpals.definition: Group of eight small bones that make up the wrist.
Carpals.function: Facilitate wrist movement and flexibility; connect hand to forearm.

Metatarsals.definition: Long bones in the foot located between the ankle and toes.
Metatarsals.function: Provide structure to the foot; support body weight during standing and walking.
